   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(erl_expand_records_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %%-define(debug, true).
   24: 
   25: -ifdef(debug).
   26: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   27: -define(config(X,Y), foo).
   28: -define(privdir, "erl_expand_records_SUITE_priv").
   29: -define(t, test_server).
   30: -else.
   31: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   32: -define(privdir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)).
   33: -endif.
   34: 
   35: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   36: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   37: 	 init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   38: 
   39: -export([attributes/1, expr/1, guard/1,
   40:          init/1, pattern/1, strict/1, update/1,
   41: 	 otp_5915/1, otp_7931/1, otp_5990/1,
   42: 	 otp_7078/1, maps/1,
   43:          side_effects/1]).
   44: 
   45: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   46:     Config.
   47: 
   48: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   49:     ok.
   50: 
   51: suite() ->
   52:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   53:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   54: 
   55: all() -> 
   56:     [attributes, expr, guard, init,
   57:      pattern, strict, update, maps,
   58:      side_effects, {group, tickets}].
   59: 
   60: groups() -> 
   61:     [{tickets, [],
   62:       [otp_5915, otp_7931, otp_5990, otp_7078]}].
   63: 
   64: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   68:     ok.
   69: 
   70: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   71:     Config.
   72: 
   73: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   74:     Config.
   75: 
   76: 
   77: %% Import module and functions.
   78: attributes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   79:     Ts = [
   80: 	  <<"-import(lists, [append/2, reverse/1]).
   81: 
   82:          -record(r, {a,b}).
   83: 
   84: t() ->
   85:     [2,1] = reverse(append([1],[2])),
   86:     3 = length([1,2,3]),
   87:     3 = record_info(size, r),
   88:     [a, b] = record_info(fields, r),
   89:     [_|_] = erl_expand_records_SUITE:all(),
   90:     ok.
   91: ">>
   92:       ],
   93:     run(Config, Ts),
   94:     ok.
   95:     
   96: %% Some expressions.
   97: expr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   98:     Ts = [
   99:       <<"
  100:          -record(r, {a,b,c}).
  101: 
  102:          t() ->
  103:              [1,2] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  104:                                R#r.a < 3],
  105:              [1,2] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  106:                                begin R#r.a < 3 end],
  107:              [1,2,3] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  108:                                  begin is_record(R, r) end],
  109:              [1,2,3] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  110:                                  begin erlang:is_record(R, r) end],
  111:              ok.
  112:       ">>,
  113:       <<"
  114:          -record(r, {a,b,c}).
  115: 
  116:          f(X) -> X.
  117: 
  118:          t() ->
  119:              A = {$c, 1, 3.14, a, \"hi\", [], [a,b]},
  120:              R = #r{a = element(6, A), b = #r.b},
  121:              3 = R#r.b,
  122:              <<1:8>> = <<(begin erlang:element(2, A) end):8>>,
  123:              self() ! {a, message, []},
  124:              One = 1 = fun f/1(1),
  125:              2 = fun(X) -> X end(One + One),
  126:              3 = fun exprec_test:f/1(3),
  127:              4 = exprec_test:f(4),
  128:              5 = f(5),
  129:              L = receive 
  130:                      {a,message,L0} ->
  131:                          L0
  132:                  end,
  133:              case catch a:foo(bar) of
  134:                  {'EXIT', _} -> ok
  135:              end,
  136:              _ = receive 			%Suppress warning.
  137:                     noop ->
  138:                        1/(length(L) - 0)
  139:                  after 0 ->
  140:                     ok
  141:                  end,
  142:              if 
  143:                  R#r.c =:= undefined ->
  144:                      ok;
  145:                  true ->
  146:                      not_ok
  147:              end.
  148: 
  149:          is_record(_, _, _) ->
  150:              error(wrong_is_record).
  151:       ">>,
  152:       <<"
  153:          -record(foo, {bar = [Bar || Bar <- ?MODULE:id([]), size(Bar) > 0]}).
  154: 
  155:          t() ->
  156:              {'EXIT',{{bad_filter,{foo,[]}},[_|_]}} = catch gh6501a(whatever),
  157:              [whatever] = gh6501b(whatever),
  158:              ok.
  159: 
  160:          gh6501a(Bar) ->
  161:              [Bar || #foo{}].
  162: 
  163:          gh6501b(Bar) ->
  164:              [Bar || is_tuple(#foo{})].
  165: 
  166:          id(I) -> I.
  167:       ">>
  168:       ],
  169: 
  170:     %% The code above should run equally well with and without
  171:     %% strict record tests.
  172:     run(Config, Ts, [no_strict_record_tests]),
  173:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  174:     
  175:     ok.
  176:     
  177: %% is_record in guards.
  178: guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  179:     File = filename("guard.erl", Config),
  180:     Beam = filename("guard.beam", Config),
  181:     Test = <<"-module(guard).
  182: 
  183:               -export([t/1]).
  184: 
  185:               -record(r, {a,b}).
  186: 
  187:               t(_) when is_record(3, r) ->
  188:                   1;
  189:               t(_) when is_record(a, r) ->
  190:                   2;
  191:               t(_) when is_record(3.14, r) ->
  192:                   3;
  193:               t(_) when is_record([], r) ->
  194:                   4;
  195:               t(_) when is_record([a], r) ->
  196:                   5;
  197:               t(_) when is_record($a, r) ->
  198:                   6;
  199:               t(_) when is_record(\"foo\", r) ->
  200:                   7;
  201:               t(_) when is_record(#r.a, r) ->
  202:                   8;
  203:               t(_) when is_record(<<\"foo\">>, r) -> % line 23
  204:                   9;
  205:               t(_) when is_record(1 + 2, r) ->
  206:                   10;
  207:               t(_) when is_record(+ 3, r) ->
  208:                   11;
  209:               t(_) ->
  210:                   12.
  211:              ">>,
  212: 
  213:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
  214:     {ok, guard, Ws} = compile:file(File, [return,{outdir,?privdir}]),
  215:     Warnings = [L || {_File,WL} <- Ws, {L,sys_core_fold,{nomatch,guard}} <- WL],
  216:     [{7,15}, {9,15}, {11,15}, {13,15}, {15,15}, {17,15},
  217:      {19,15}, {21,15}, {23,15}, {25,15}, {27,15}] = Warnings,
  218: 
  219:     ok = file:delete(File),
  220:     ok = file:delete(Beam),
  221:     ok.
  222: 
  223: %% Wildcard initialisation.
  224: init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  225:     Ts = [
  226:           ~S"""
  227:           -record(r, {a,b,c,d = foo}).
  228: 
  229:           t() ->
  230:               R = #r{_ = init, b = b},
  231:               #r{c = init, b = b, a = init} = R,
  232:               case R of
  233:                   #r{b = b, _ = init} -> ok;
  234:                   _ -> not_ok
  235:               end.
  236:           """,
  237:           ~S"""
  238:             -record(r0, {rf0}).
  239:             -record(r1, {rf1 = (#r0{rf0 = #{ok => ok || ok}})}).
  240: 
  241:             t() ->
  242:                 catch <<0 || #r1{}>>,
  243:                 ok.
  244:             """
  245:          ],
  246:     run(Config, Ts),
  247:     ok.
  248: 
  249: %% Some patterns.
  250: pattern(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  251:     Ts = [
  252:       <<"-import(lists, [append/2, reverse/1]).
  253: 
  254:          -record(r, {a,b}).
  255: 
  256:          t() ->
  257:              1 = t(#r{}),
  258:              2 = t($a),
  259:              3 = t(1000),
  260:              4 = t({1000}),
  261:              5 = t(3),
  262:              6 = t(-3.14),
  263:              7 = t({4.0}),
  264:              8 = t(3.14),
  265:              9 = t(\"str\"),
  266:              10 = t([]),
  267:              11 = t([a|b]),
  268:              12 = t(\"string\"),
  269:              13 = t({[]}),
  270:              14 = t({a,b}),
  271:              15 = t({{}}),
  272:              16 = t({tuple,tupel}),
  273:              17 = t(4),
  274:              18 = t(10),
  275:              19 = t({a}),
  276:              20 = t(<<100:8,220:8>>),
  277:              21 = t(#r{a = #r{}}),
  278:              22 = t(2),
  279:              23 = t(#r{a = #r{}, b = b}),
  280:              24 = t(abc),
  281:              ok.
  282: 
  283:          t(abc) ->
  284:              24;
  285:          t($a) ->
  286:              2;
  287:          t(3) ->
  288:              5;
  289:          t(3.14) ->
  290:              8;
  291:          t(\"str\") ->
  292:              9;
  293:          t([]) ->
  294:              10;
  295:          t([a|b]) ->
  296:              11;
  297:          t(L) when is_list(L) ->
  298:              12;
  299:          t({L}) when list(L) ->
  300:              13;
  301:          t({a,b}) ->
  302:              14;
  303:          t({T}) when is_tuple(T) ->
  304:              15;
  305:          t(+ 4) ->
  306:              17;
  307:          t(3+7) ->
  308:              18;
  309:          t(<<A:8, (100+120):8>>) when A =:= 100 ->
  310:              20;
  311:          t(#r{a = #r{}, b = undefined}) ->
  312:              21;
  313:          t(#r.a) ->
  314:              22;
  315:          t(A) when is_record(A, r), record(element(2, A), r) ->
  316:              23;
  317:          t(A) when is_record(A, r) ->
  318:              1;
  319:          t(I) when is_integer(I) ->
  320:              3;
  321:          t({I}) when integer(I) ->
  322:              4;
  323:          t({F}) when float(F) ->
  324:              7;
  325:          t({A} = B) when A < B ->
  326:              19;
  327:          t(F) when is_float(F) ->
  328:              6;
  329:          t(T) when tuple(T) ->
  330:              16.
  331:       ">>
  332:       ],
  333:     run(Config, Ts),
  334:     ok.
  335:     
  336: strict(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  337:     Ts1 = [
  338:       <<"-record(r1, {a,b}).
  339:          -record(r2, {a,b}).
  340: 
  341:          t() ->
  342:              A = #r1{a = 1, b = 2},
  343:              ok = try 
  344:                       {1, 2} = {A#r2.a, A#r2.b},
  345:                       not_ok
  346:                   catch error:{badrecord,{r1,1,2}} -> ok
  347:                   end,
  348:              try
  349:                  case foo of
  350:                      _ when A#r2.a =:= 1 -> not_ok
  351:                  end
  352:              catch error:_ -> ok
  353:              end.
  354:          element(_, _) ->
  355:              error(wrong_element).
  356:       ">>
  357:       ],
  358:     run(Config, Ts1, [strict_record_tests]),
  359: 
  360:     Ts2 = [
  361:       <<"-record(r1, {a,b}).
  362:          -record(r2, {a,b}).
  363: 
  364:          t() ->
  365:              A = #r1{a = 1, b = 2},
  366:              {1, 2} = {A#r2.a, A#r2.b},
  367:              case foo of
  368:                  _ when A#r2.a =:= 1 -> ok
  369:              end.
  370:          element(_, _) ->
  371:              error(wrong_element).
  372:       ">>
  373:       ],
  374:     run(Config, Ts2, [no_strict_record_tests]),
  375:     ok.
  376:     
  377: %% Record updates.
  378: update(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  379:     Ts = [
  380:       <<"-record(r, {a,b,c,d,e,f}).
  381: 
  382:          t() ->
  383:              R0 = #r{},
  384:              R1 = R0#r{a = #r.a, e = {x,y}},
  385:              2 = R1#r.a,
  386:              R2 = R1#r{},
  387:              true = R1 =:= R2,
  388:              R3 = R2#r{c = fun(X) -> X end, 
  389:                        d = <<\"foo\">>, 
  390:                        e = [x,y,z], 
  391:                        f = {R0,R1}},
  392:              R4 = R3#r{a = R3#r{b = #r{}}},
  393:              true = erlang:is_record((R4#r.a)#r.b, r),
  394:              #r{a = R0, b = 3, c = 3.14, d = [], e = [[]], f = [{}]} = 
  395:                  R4#r{a = R0, b = 3, c = 3.14, d = [], e = [[]], f = [{}]},
  396:              ok.
  397: 
  398:          %% Just playing around a bit...
  399:          t1() ->
  400:              ((#r{a = (#r{b = #r{}})#r{a = #r{}}})#r{b = #r{}})#r{c = #r{}}.
  401: 
  402:          t2() ->
  403:              R0 = #r{},
  404:              #r{_ = R0#r{a = ok}}.
  405: 
  406:          %% Implicit calls to setelement/3 must go to the BIF,
  407:          %% not to this function.
  408:          setelement(_, _, _) ->
  409:              erlang:error(wrong_setelement_called).
  410:       ">>
  411:       ],
  412:     run(Config, Ts),
  413:     ok.
  414: 
  415: maps(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  416:     Ts = [<<"-record(rr, {a,b,c}).
  417:              t() ->
  418:                  R0 = id(#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3}),
  419:                  R1 = id(#rr{a=4,b=5,c=6}),
  420:                  [{R0,R1}] =
  421:                      maps:to_list(#{#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3} => #rr{a=4,b=5,c=6}}),
  422:                  #{#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3} := #rr{a=1,b=2,c=3}} =
  423:                      #{#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3} => R1}#{#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3} := R0},
  424:                  ok.
  425: 
  426:              id(X) -> X.
  427:             ">>],
  428:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  429:     ok.
  430: 
  431: %% Strict record tests in guards.
  432: otp_5915(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  433:     %% These tests are also run by the compiler's record_SUITE.
  434:     Ts = [
  435:       <<"-record(r, {a = 4,b}).
  436:          -record(r1, {a,b}).
  437:          -record(r2, {a = #r1{},b,c=length([1,2,3])}).
  438:          -record(r3, {a = fun(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}).
  439: 
  440:          t() ->
  441:              foo = fun(A) when A#r1.a > A#r1.b -> foo end(#r1{b = 2}),
  442:              0 = fun(A) when A#r2.a -> 0 end(#r2{a = true}),
  443:              1 = fun(A) when (#r1{a = A})#r1.a > 2 -> 1 end(3),
  444:              2 = fun(N) when ((#r2{a = #r{a = 4}, b = length([a,b,c])})#r2.a)#r.a > N ->
  445:                          2 end(2),
  446:              3 = fun(A) when (A#r2.a)#r1.a =:= 3 -> 3 end(#r2{a = #r1{a = 3}}),
  447:              ok = fun() ->
  448:                           F = fun(A) when record(A#r.a, r1) -> 4;
  449:                                  (A) when record(A#r1.a, r1) -> 5
  450:                               end,
  451:                           5 = F(#r1{a = #r1{}}),
  452:                           4 = F(#r{a = #r1{}}),
  453:                           ok
  454:                   end(),
  455:              3 = fun(A) when record(A#r1.a, r),
  456:                                    (A#r1.a)#r.a > 3 -> 3
  457:                  end(#r1{a = #r{a = 4}}),
  458:              7 = fun(A) when record(A#r3.a, r1) -> 7 end(#r3{}),
  459:              [#r1{a = 2,b = 1}] = 
  460:                  fun() ->
  461:                          [A || A <- [#r1{a = 1, b = 3}, 
  462:                                      #r2{a = 2,b = 1}, 
  463:                                      #r1{a = 2, b = 1}],
  464:                                A#r1.a > 
  465:                                    A#r1.b]
  466:                  end(),
  467:              {[_],b} = 
  468:                  fun(L) ->
  469:                          %% A is checked only once:
  470:                          R1 = [{A,B} || A <- L, A#r1.a, B <- L, A#r1.b],
  471:                          A = #r2{a = true},
  472:                          %% A is checked again:
  473:                          B = if A#r1.a -> a; true -> b end,
  474:                          {R1,B}
  475:                  end([#r1{a = true, b = true}]),
  476: 
  477:              p = fun(A) when (A#r1.a =:= 2) or (A#r2.a =:= 1) -> o;
  478:                     (_) -> p
  479:                  end(#r1{a = 2}),
  480: 
  481:              o = fun(A) when (A#r1.a =:= 2) orelse (A#r2.a =:= 1) -> o;
  482:                     (_) -> p
  483:                  end(#r1{a = 2}),
  484: 
  485:              3 = fun(A) when A#r1.a > 3, 
  486:                              record(A, r1) -> 3
  487:                  end(#r1{a = 5}),
  488: 
  489:              ok = fun() ->
  490:                           F = fun(A) when (A#r2.a =:= 1) orelse (A#r2.a) -> 2;
  491:                                  (A) when (A#r1.a =:= 1) orelse (A#r1.a) -> 1;
  492:                                  (A) when (A#r2.a =:= 2) andalso (A#r2.b) -> 3
  493:                               end,
  494:                           1 = F(#r1{a = 1}),
  495:                           2 = F(#r2{a = true}),
  496:                           3 = F(#r2{a = 2, b = true}),
  497:                           ok
  498:                   end(),
  499: 
  500:              b = fun(A) when false or not (A#r.a =:= 1) -> a;
  501:                     (_) -> b
  502:                  end(#r1{a = 1}),
  503:              b = fun(A) when not (A#r.a =:= 1) or false -> a;
  504:                     (_) -> b
  505:                  end(#r1{a = 1}),
  506: 
  507:              ok = fun() ->
  508:                           F = fun(A) when not (A#r.a =:= 1) -> yes;
  509:                                  (_) -> no
  510:                               end,
  511:                           no = F(#r1{a = 2}),
  512:                           yes = F(#r{a = 2}),
  513:                           no = F(#r{a = 1}),
  514:                           ok
  515:                   end(),
  516: 
  517:              a = fun(A) when record(A, r),
  518:                              A#r.a =:= 1,
  519:                              A#r.b =:= 2 ->a
  520:                  end(#r{a = 1, b = 2}),
  521:              a = fun(A) when erlang:is_record(A, r),
  522:                              A#r.a =:= 1,
  523:                              A#r.b =:= 2 -> a
  524:                  end(#r{a = 1, b = 2}),
  525:              a = fun(A) when is_record(A, r),
  526:                              A#r.a =:= 1,
  527:                              A#r.b =:= 2 -> a
  528:                  end(#r{a = 1, b = 2}),
  529: 
  530:              nop = fun(A) when (is_record(A, r1) and (A#r1.a > 3)) or (A#r2.a < 1) ->
  531:                            japp;
  532:                       (_) ->
  533:                            nop
  534:                    end(#r2{a = 0}),
  535:              nop = fun(A) when (A#r1.a > 3) or (A#r2.a < 1) -> japp;
  536:                       (_) ->
  537:                            nop
  538:                    end(#r2{a = 0}),
  539: 
  540:              ok = fun() ->
  541:                           F = fun(A) when (A#r1.a =:= 2) or (A#r2.a =:= 1) -> o;
  542:                                  (_) -> p
  543:                               end,
  544:                           p = F(#r2{a = 1}),
  545:                           p = F(#r1{a = 2}),
  546:                           ok
  547:                   end(),
  548: 
  549:              ok = fun() ->
  550:                           F = fun(A) when fail, A#r1.a; A#r1.a -> ab;
  551:                                  (_) -> bu
  552:                               end,
  553:                           ab = F(#r1{a = true}),
  554:                           bu = F(#r2{a = true}),
  555:                           ok
  556:                   end(),
  557: 
  558:              both = fun(A) when A#r.a, A#r.b -> both 
  559:                     end(#r{a = true, b = true}),
  560: 
  561:              ok = fun() ->
  562:                           F = fun(A, B) when ((A#r1.a) orelse (B#r2.a)) 
  563:                                              or (B#r2.b) or (A#r1.b) -> true;
  564:                                  (_, _) -> false
  565:                               end,
  566:                           true = F(#r1{a = false, b = false}, #r2{a = false, b = true}),
  567:                           false = F(#r1{a = true, b = true}, #r1{a = false, b = true}),
  568:                           ok
  569:                   end(),
  570: 
  571:              ok.
  572:       ">>
  573:       ],
  574:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  575:     ok.
  576: 
  577: %% Test optimization of record accesses and is_record/3 tests in guards.
  578: otp_7931(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  579:     Ts = [
  580:       <<"-record(r, {a = 4,b}).
  581:          -record(r1, {a,b}).
  582:          -record(r2, {a = #r1{},b,c=length([1,2,3])}).
  583:          -record(r3, {a = fun(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}).
  584: 
  585:          t() ->
  586:              ok = fun() ->
  587:                     F = fun(F, [H,H|T]) when is_record(H, r) ->
  588:                                 [H|F(F, T)];
  589:                              (F, [H|T]) when is_record(H, r) ->
  590:                                 [H|F(F, T)];
  591:                              (_, []) -> []
  592:                           end,
  593:                     [#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=1,b=42}] =
  594:                        F(F, [#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=1,b=42}]),
  595:                     {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(F, [#r1{}])),
  596:                     ok
  597:                   end(),
  598: 
  599:              true = fun() ->
  600:                       R = #r{},
  601:                       if is_record(R, r) -> true; true -> false end
  602:                      end(),
  603: 
  604:              ok = fun() ->
  605:                       F = fun(true, B) when B#r1.a -> ok;
  606:                              (false, _) -> error
  607:                       end,
  608:                       ok = F(true, #r1{a=true}),
  609:                       error = F(false, anything_goes),
  610:                       {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(true, #r1{})),
  611:                       {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(true, #r{})),
  612:                       ok
  613:                   end(),
  614: 
  615: 	     ok = fun() ->
  616: 		      F = fun([{a,R}=T]) when R#r.a =:= 42 ->
  617:                                    {ok,tuple_size(T)};
  618: 			     ([{a,R}=T]) when R#r1.a =:= 7 ->
  619:                                    {ok,tuple_size(T)};
  620: 			     (_) -> error
  621: 		          end,
  622: 		      {ok,2} = F([{a,#r{a=42}}]),
  623: 		      {ok,2} = F([{a,#r1{a=7}}]),
  624: 		      error = F([{a,#r1{}}]),
  625: 		      error = F({a,b,c}),
  626: 		      error = F([]),
  627: 		      ok
  628: 	     end(),
  629: 
  630: 	     ok = fun() ->
  631: 		      F = fun(X, Y, Z) when is_record(X, r1) andalso
  632:                                             (is_record(Y, r2) orelse
  633:                                              is_record(Z, r3)) -> true;
  634: 			     (_, _, _) -> false
  635: 		          end,
  636: 		      true = F(#r1{}, #r2{}, #r3{}),
  637:  		      true = F(#r1{}, #r2{}, blurf),
  638:  		      true = F(#r1{}, blurf, #r3{}),
  639:  		      false = F(#r1{}, blurf, blurf),
  640: 		      false = F(blurf, #r2{}, #r3{}),
  641:  		      false = F(blurf, #r2{}, blurf),
  642:  		      false = F(blurf, blurf, #r3{}),
  643:  		      false = F(blurf, blurf, blurf),
  644: 		      ok
  645: 	     end(),
  646: 
  647: 	     ok = fun() ->
  648: 		      F = fun(R=#r{a=42}) when R#r.b =:= 7 ->
  649:                                    {ok,R};
  650: 			     (_) -> error
  651: 		          end,
  652: 		      {ok,#r{a=42,b=7}} = F(#r{a=42,b=7}),
  653: 		      error = F(#r{}),
  654: 		      error = F([a,b,c]),
  655: 		      ok
  656: 	     end(),
  657: 
  658:              ok.
  659:       ">>
  660:       ],
  661:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  662:     ok.
  663: 
  664: %% OTP-5990. {erlang,is_record}.
  665: otp_5990(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  666:     Ts = [
  667:       <<"
  668:          -record(r, {a,b,c}).
  669: 
  670:          t() ->
  671:              [1,2,3] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  672:                                  begin {erlang,is_record}(R, r) end],
  673:              [1,2,3] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  674:                                  begin {erlang,is_record}(R, r) end],
  675:              ok.
  676:       ">>,
  677: 
  678:       <<"
  679:          -record('OrdSet', {orddata = {},
  680:                             ordtype = {}}).
  681: 
  682:          to_sets(S) when tuple(S#'OrdSet'.ordtype) ->
  683:              ok.
  684: 
  685:          lc(S) ->
  686:              [X || X <- [S], tuple(X#'OrdSet'.ordtype)].
  687: 
  688:          t() ->
  689:              S = #'OrdSet'{},
  690:              ok = to_sets(S),
  691:              [S] = lc(S),
  692:              ok.
  693:       ">>
  694:       ],
  695:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  696:     ok.
  697:         
  698: 
  699: %% OTP-7078. Record update: missing test.
  700: otp_7078(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  701:     Ts = [
  702:       <<"
  703:          -record(r, {f}).
  704:          -record(r2, {}).
  705: 
  706:          t() ->
  707:              {'EXIT',_} = (catch (#r2{})#r{}),
  708:              {'EXIT',_} = (catch (#r2{})#r{f = 2}),
  709:              ok.
  710:       ">>,
  711: 
  712:       <<"
  713:          -record(r, {f}).
  714: 
  715:          maker(F) -> 
  716:              put(a, get(a)+1),
  717:              #r{f = F}.
  718: 
  719:          t() ->
  720:              put(a, 0),
  721:              (maker(2))#r{},
  722:              1 = get(a),
  723:              ok.
  724:       ">>
  725: 
  726:       ],
  727:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  728:     ok.
  729: 
  730: id(I) -> I.
  731: 
  732: -record(side_effects, {a,b,c}).
  733: 
  734: %% Make sure that the record expression is only evaluated once.
  735: side_effects(_Config) ->
  736:     init_counter(),
  737: 
  738:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,0},_}} = catch (id(bump_counter()))#side_effects{a=1},
  739:     1 = read_counter(),
  740: 
  741:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,1},_}} = catch (id(bump_counter()))#side_effects.b,
  742:     2 = read_counter(),
  743: 
  744:     ok.
  745: 
  746: init_counter() ->
  747:     put(counter, 0).
  748: 
  749: bump_counter() ->
  750:     put(counter, get(counter) + 1).
  751: 
  752: read_counter() ->
  753:     get(counter).
  754: 
  755: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  756: 
  757: run(Config, Tests) ->
  758:     run(Config, Tests, []).
  759: 
  760: run(Config, Tests, Opts) ->
  761:     F = fun(P) ->
  762:                 {SourceFile, Mod} = compile_file_mod(Config),
  763:                 _ = compile_file(Config, P, Opts),
  764:                 AbsFile = filename:rootname(SourceFile, ".erl"),
  765:                 code:purge(Mod),
  766:                 code:load_abs(AbsFile, Mod),
  767:                 case catch Mod:t() of
  768:                     {'EXIT', _Reason} = Error ->
  769:                         io:format("failed, got ~p~n", [Error]),
  770:                         fail();
  771:                     ok ->
  772:                         ok
  773:                 end
  774:         end,
  775:     lists:foreach(F, Tests).
  776: 
  777: %% Compiles a test module and returns the list of errors and warnings.
  778: 
  779: compile_file(Config, Test0, Opts0) ->
  780:     {File, _Mod} = compile_file_mod(Config),
  781:     Filename = 'exprec_test.erl',
  782:     Test = list_to_binary(["-module(exprec_test). "
  783:                            "-compile(export_all). ",
  784:                            Test0]),
  785:     File = filename(Filename, Config),
  786:     Opts = [export_all,return,{outdir,?privdir}|Opts0],
  787:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
  788:     {ok, _M, Ws} = compile:file(File, Opts),
  789:     warnings(File, Ws).
  790: 
  791: compile_file_mod(Config) ->
  792:     {filename('exprec_test.erl', Config), exprec_test}.
  793: 
  794: filename(Name, Config) when is_atom(Name) ->
  795:     filename(atom_to_list(Name), Config);
  796: filename(Name, Config) ->
  797:     filename:join(?privdir, Name).
  798: 
  799: warnings(File, Ws) ->
  800:     case lists:append([W || {F, W} <- Ws, F =:= File]) of
  801:         [] -> [];
  802:         L -> {warnings, L}
  803:     end.
  804: 
  805: fail() ->
  806:     ct:fail(failed).
